title: RomaMarquez
author: RomaMarquez
content: Hello,I need to make payments in USDT (TRC-20) to 50 different addresses. Does anyone know a wallet which allow to make aggregated payment to 50 different wallets in one transaction? I found such mass-payments option in Electrum wallet but this wallet supports only Bitcoin payments, while I need a wallet supporting USDT TRC-20.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: RomaMarquez on May 23, 2022, 12:02:10 PMHello,I need to make payments in USDT (TRC-20) to 50 different addresses. Does anyone know a wallet which allow to make aggregated payment to 50 different wallets in one transaction? I found such mass-payments option in Electrum wallet but this wallet supports only Bitcoin payments, while I need a wallet supporting USDT TRC-20.As far as I know, no crypto wallet app supports this for the Tron network. My advice, you better ask the 50 recipients for another network address, you can ask them to use BSC or Polygon to make it cheaper.Once you get their wallet address, you can just install Coin98 Wallet, their app supports bulk sending from 1 wallet to another. For complete information, you can read the following article: https://coin98insights.com/coin98wallet-multisend

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: I only know about thesehttps://tronsender.com/https://cointool.app/multiSender/trxI never had any experience with tron sender and if you are deciding to try this and you are trying with your own risk, im not suggesting you to try such multi sender app caused by the reputation was still unknown. I know about cointool app but i don't know whether this is supporting tron USDT or not. You can check it by yourself.

comments.author: hyudien
comments.body: If I'm not mistaken USDT (TRC-20) will charge you $1 for a single transaction. I think you are better off using another alternative like MAAManda said. You are requesting another payment address that will have a much lower transaction fee. In addition, for USDT (TRC-20) 50 addresses delivery is not too long. It depends on the wallet you use.

I've done some transactions before for USDT(TRC20) and it didn't cost me $1. That's not really a costly transaction and it is one of the cheapest networks to transfer USDT. If calculating the usual transaction that's being done, it's going to be about $0.5 well, that's a 50% discount from what you've said. But I don't know if sending the whole transaction in batches just like what OP is asking if that's going to him more. @OP I haven't tronsender but it's the one that showed when I've looked for some answers and suggestions.
